perturbation.original_text: This Second Amendment shall be effective from The Second Amendment Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2021. Upon expiration, this Second Amendment shall be of no further force or effect, and the terms and conditions of the Agreement shall as they were before the Second Amendment Effective Date. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, a Party's right to enforce the terms and conditions of this Second Amendment shall survive the Second Amendment's expiration.
perturbation.changed_text: This Second Amendment shall be effective from The Second Amendment Effective Date and shall expire on December 31, 2021. Upon expiration, this Second Amendment shall be of no further force or effect, and the terms and conditions of the Agreement shall as they were before the Second Amendment Effective Date. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, a Party's right to enforce the terms and conditions of this Second Amendment shall survive the Second Amendment's expiration. However, Premier's right to enforce the terms and conditions of this Second Amendment regarding pricing for Bottled Products will not survive the Second Amendment's expiration.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that a Party's right to enforce the terms of the Second Amendment survives its expiration. The modified version introduces an exception, stating that Premier's right to enforce pricing terms specifically for Bottled Products does not survive expiration. This creates a contradiction, making it unclear whether Premier can enforce these pricing terms after December 31, 2021, and creates potential for dispute.

perturbation.original_text: "Heritage shall produce the products described on Schedule A and Schedule A-1 attached hereto, as may be amended by the Parties hereafter from time to time (the "Products," each individual unit of Product "Unit"), for Premier at [***] Heritage's or Heritage's wholly owned subsidiary, Jasper's facilities (the "Facilities"). [***], except that, notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, [***]."
perturbation.changed_text: "Heritage shall produce the products described on Schedule A and Schedule A-1 attached hereto, as may be amended by the Parties hereafter from time to time (the "Products," each individual unit of Product "Unit"), for Premier at [***] Heritage's or Heritage's wholly owned subsidiary, Jasper's facilities (the "Facilities"). [***], except that, notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, Heritage may choose not to produce certain Products if demand is low."
perturbation.explanation: The original text implies that Heritage *shall* produce the products, with exceptions noted by [***], creating an expectation of production. The modified text adds a clause allowing Heritage to *choose* not to produce certain Products if demand is low. This creates a contradiction because the mandatory 'shall produce' is weakened by the discretionary 'may choose not to produce', which may cause uncertainty to premier on expected output volume.

perturbation.original_text: "Heritage shall purchase all ingredients and packaging materials identified in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l. Heritage shall not, however, purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those required [***]."
perturbation.changed_text: "Heritage shall purchase all ingredients and packaging materials identified in the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l to be used in connection with the manufacturer of the Products. Heritage shall invoice Premier through the [***] billing as identified on the relevant Schedule C or Schedule C-l. Heritage shall not, however, purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those required [***]. Notwithstanding the previous sentence, Heritage may purchase and maintain a three-month supply of ingredients to ensure uninterrupted production."
perturbation.explanation: The original text states Heritage shall not purchase ingredients or packaging materials in excess of those required. The modified text adds a sentence stating they may purchase and maintain a three-month supply. This introduces a contradiction regarding the quantity of materials Heritage is allowed to purchase, which may create dispute over inventory levels.
